result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodnesha Dezire Hall

records.addlTxt: Submitted by Atty Terry Rose

11:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rodnesha Dezire Hall in court.  Attorney Christopher William Rose in court for Rodnesha Dezire Hall. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Motion to sever filed by Attorney Rose. The State has no objection to serving this case with the co-defendants' cases. Discussion held. Parties are still waiting for the drug tests results to come back from the lab. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Demand for Discovery
Motion hearing on October 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:12 PM  State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Rodnesha Dezire Hall, appeared with Attorney Christopher William Rose.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Rose filed a motion to adjourn the jury trial and to sever the DE's case from the co-defendant's case. Court will grant the motion to adjourn the jury trial. Court will not hear the motion to sever at this time, but will address it at the next hearing.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
re:  sever case from co-defts.
Final pre-trial on August 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court is no longer available the morning of 7/13/22 and Atty Rose is unavailable in the afternoon.  Hearing adj. to 8/4/22 at 2:00 PM pending confirmation from Atty Rose.

Defendant, Rodnesha Dezire Hall, appeared with Attorney Christopher William Rose.    Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:10 am.  Jury selection scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
